question: Which two countries form the basin countries of Savu Sea?
explanation: Indonesia and Timor-Leste form the basin countries of the Savu Sea. The Savu Sea forms part of the Indian Ocean in the East Indian Archipelago. The Savu Sea is bordered by the Flores Sea and the Banda Sea to the north. Ombai Strait connects the Banda Sea to the north and the Savu Sea to the southwest.
